thread.title: 19 Products To Help You Cook The Best Valentine's Day Dinner Ever
thread.title_full: 19 Products To Help You Cook The Best Valentine's Day Dinner Ever

author: Elizabeth Lilly
title: 19 Products To Help You Cook The Best Valentine's Day Dinner Ever

organizations.name: chili lime tilapia with avocado crema

text:
View this image ›
Andrew Richard / BuzzFeed We hope you love the products we recommend! Just so you know, BuzzFeed may collect a share of sales from the links on this page.
ID: 10411829 1. A dinner cookbook chock full of GOOD recipes because engagement chicken and sex pasta are just plain dumb. View this image ›
food52.com Get it from Amazon for $21 or a signed copy from Food52 for $36 .
ID: 10396849 2. A dry rub seasoner for smearing on a tantalizing concoction. View this image ›
target.com Get it from Target for $9.99 .
Put the tool to the test with our One-Pan Baby Back Ribs Recipe here .
ID: 10395386 3. A 3-in-1 avocado tool that let’s you slit, pit, and slice up avocado for the perfect guac. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $9.95 .
Make it work for its supper with our Chili Lime Tilapia With Avocado Crema recipe here .
ID: 10405788 4. A pair of cut-resistant gloves so you don’t dress the salad in blood. View this image ›
amazon.com Get them from Amazon for $11.99+ . / Available in four sizes.
ID: 10406165 5. This mandolin slicer to evenly slice cheese, veggies, and other oh-so-romantic eats for a top-notch presentation. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $19.99 .
ID: 10397388 6. A pretty place-setting sheet for serving (and easily cleaning up) the sloppiest of meals. View this image ›
highfashionhome.com Get 50 sheets from High Fashion Home for $25 .
ID: 10396937 7. A sushi bazooka so your SO thinks that you used a bamboo mat to make picturesque rolls. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $8.37 .
Give it a go on one of these Non-Traditional Veggie Sushi Recipes here .
ID: 10404996 8. A cauliflower tool for zipping through ingredient prep. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $8 .
Use it on our Buffalo Cauliflower Tacos recipe here .
ID: 10405274 9. A silicone spatula that’s heat-resistant up to 480 degrees F, will prevent a sitcom-style fire-alarm snafu. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $6.95 .
Wield it on our Honey Garlic Shrimp Stir-Fry recipe here .
ID: 10405112 10. An instructional pastry mat that’ll help you master the art of rolling out dough. View this image ›
surlatable.com Get it from Sur la Table for $15.96 .
Try it out on one of our Fabulous Pie recipes here .
ID: 10406791 11. A simple knife sharpener that gives you some versatility. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $5.99 .
ID: 10405739 12. A seasoned cast-iron skillet that’s ready for your culinary creations. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $15.92 . / Available in eight sizes.
Put it to work with one of these Tantalizing Cast Iron Skillet Recipes here .
ID: 10405769 13. A lemon squeezer that’ll help you juice up a variety of dishes. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $7.49 .
Squeeze it out on our One-Pan Salmon Dinner recipe here .
ID: 10405831 14. A pot lid-holder and spoon rest to keep your counters (and dinner prep tools) pristine. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $12.90 .
ID: 10405994 15. A rapid egg cooker so there’ll be one less thing you have to keep an eye on. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $17.33+ . / Available in three colors.
Give it a go with one of these Crazy Deviled Egg Recipes here .
ID: 10406010 16. A scraper to rake up every morsel of dough and clear the way for more food prep. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $9.95 .
ID: 10406387 17. A small cooking torch for melting cheese, browning meat, carmelizing sugar, and handling other fiery tasks. amazon.com , amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $19.99 .
Fire it up for our Cookies and Crème Brûlée recipe here .
ID: 10406447 18. A pair of kitchen shears to cut through strips of bacon, romaine, whatever. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $9.99 .
Use them to make quick work of our Ramen Carbonara recipe here .
ID: 10406679 19. And a microplane so you can actually get the perfect consistency of cheese or citrus zest that a grater just can’t manage. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it from Amazon for $11.49 .
Wield it for dusting cheese on Chef Nyesha Arrington’s Meaty Chili Spaghetti recipe here .
ID: 10406966 Want even more great product suggestions? Sign up for BuzzFeed’s Gift Guide Newsletter!
View this embed ›
